ActExplosives Act
SubjectRegulations Amending the Explosives Regulations, 2013
PrecisRegulations Amending the EXPLOSIVES REGULATIONS, 2013 in order to (1) allow persons under the age of 18 to possess small arms cartridges and black powder cartouches at federal or provincial/territorial sites that hold a division 2 factory licence for the purposes of conducting sanctioned demonstrations or historical re-enactments; (2) allow an application for an authorization of explosives for a specified period to include tests conducted by foreign states; (3) allow the importation and transportation of explosives that have not been authorized into or within Canada for the Department of National Defence, the Canadian Armed Forces and international allies, using commercial freight carriers, under certain conditions; (4) create a new classification for low risk fireworks called novelty devices; (5) align the Regulations with the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act, 1992 and the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations; (6) increase the minimum age for workers at Division 1 and 2 factories and satellite sites, and for workers involved in manufacturing explosives, from 17 years of age to 18 years of age; (7) update the annual reporting requirements; (8) update the terms and conditions for licences, permits and certificates; and (9) update the screening requirements for individuals seeking approval letters as licence holders or employees to have unsupervised access to high hazard explosives.
